experience: You and Gordon both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Ed Nusbaum, and 65 others
Connect with Gordon McConnell, KAUST #Entrepreneurship Director @startup_saudi 9:20 panel on Nov 6th

We were delighted & honored to be visited by Laurene Powell Jobs, founder of the Emerson Collective and US entrepreneur, at the KAUST Entrepreneurship Center on Sunday night. The visit included meeting some of the co-founders of KAUST startups FalconVIZ, Sadeem Wireless Solutions, QUANTUM SOLUTIONS (pictured) as well as seeing some of the new 910th accelerator Takamol Holding startup teams from the fall cohort, as well as speaking to the Technology Innovation and Entrepreneurship course King Abdullah University of Science and Technology of students #KAUST #Innovation #910th #Takamol #KAUSTstartups #KAUSTInnovation
King Abdullah University of Science and Technology

In addition to the continuing role as Head of the KAUST Entrepreneurship Center, the Professor of Practice role includes the development of the Innovation Teaching & Learning strategy for KAUST including developing new for-credit curriculum in entrepreneurship, innovation, leadership, strategy and change, teaching the resulting for-credit courses including the recently implemented 'Technology Innovation and Entrepreneurship' course (fall 2016) and the 'New Product Development and Ventures' course (summer 2017) and managing the teaching resources.

As Head of the Entrepreneurship Center (EC), Gordon has led the development of the entrepreneurship and innovation culture across the KAUST campus and the wider Saudi ecosystem. This includes creating and managing initiatives that support early stage entrepreneurs and innovators, both inside and outside the university. Leading to his appointment as Professor of Practice, Gordon has developed a number of teaching and learning programs  for KAUST community students, staff and faculty as well external audiences.Under his leadership the Entrepreneurship Center has developed two startup accelerators:- The TAQADAM University Entrepreneur Accelerator, which is funded by Saudi British Bank (SABB), is the only multi-university accelerator in the region. The current cohort of 25 startups represent 13 different Saudi universities. TAQADAM is an evolution of the Hikma Intellectual Property Accelerator which originally started in March 2015.- The Takamol 910ths Startup Accelerator which the KAUST Entrepreneurship Center developed and manages on behalf of Takamol. The current cohort includes 25 Saudi startups from across the Kingdom. Gordon has led the  development and delivery of experiential, practitioner taught, practical oriented programs for students including the popular STEAM Innovation Challenge. To date over 500 Saudi students from 8 different universities have participated in STEAM challenges in collaboration with sponsor partners such as Dow Chemical and Islamic Development Bank.  He also designed, developed and launched the Corporate and  Executive Education programs in October 2014. This portfolio offers innovation, intrapreneurship, design, leadership and change training to organizations in the Kingdom including the popular REVelate Corporate Innovation Program. To date 28 organizations including Saudi Aramco, Islamic Development Bank, ALJ, SABIC, Dow Chemical, SABB and Saudi Electricity have participated in these programs.
New KAUST Entrepreneurship and Innovation Programs Offer KAUST Students and Saudi Companies Something Different

KAUST Launches IP-Based Startup Accelerator Program in Saudi Arabia - Innovation America
KAUST Launches IP-Based Startup Accelerator Program in Saudi Arabia - Innovation America

Gordon McConnell was the Associate Vice President in charge of the Entrepreneurship and Innovation Group (EIG) at Arizona State University until May 2014. EIG is the 'pracademic' side of entrepreneurship in the university, supporting startup companies including those of faculty, students, alumni and external innovators, as well as vocational training to ASU and the wider community. He was the founder and Principal Investigator of the Center of Excellence in Technology Transfer (funded by the US Dept. of Defense) and co-founder of the ASU Manufacturing Venture Fund. He joined ASU in 2011 originally in the role of Executive Director for Venture Acceleration, managing the ASU Venture Catalyst unit based in ASU SkySong which includes the Edson Student Accelerator. During his time in ASU he has developed the pracademic Rapid Startup School initiative and created the Arizona Furnace Accelerator, the first statewide accelerator for new startups based on intellectual property. The EIG team managed the startup activity of Arizona State University and works closely with the trechnology transfer group to support university spinouts. The EIG also worked with external startups, venture firms, economic development and local government to build the ecosystem and high tech cluster in Arizona. This included co-founding the ASU Early Stage Venture Fund in January 2014. During his time in ASU he won several awards at state and national level, including those for economic development by the SSTI and UEDA.  The EIG was ranked as the 10th best university accelerator in the US in 2013, and the 9th in North America in 2014 (UBI Index).

Executive profile: Gordon McConnell of Arizona State University - Phoenix Business Journal
Executive profile: Gordon McConnell of Arizona State University - Phoenix Business Journal
Assistant Vice President of the Entrepreneurship & Innovation Group (EIG)

Gordon McConnell was the Assistant Vice President in charge of the Entrepreneurship and Innovation Group at Arizona State University. He was also in charge of the marketing group for Economic Development and Corporate Engagement (EDCE) at ASU. He held the position of an assistant Professor of Practice within the ASU College of Technology and Innovation from October 2012. He joined ASU in 2011 originally in the role of Executive Director for Venture Acceleration, managing the ASU Venture Catalyst unit based in ASU SkySong which includes the Edson Student Accelerator.  During his time in ASU he developed the pracademic Rapid Startup School initiative and created the Arizona Furnace Accelerator, the first statewide accelerator for new startups based on intellectual property. He devised a number of ecosystem initiatives including the Alexandria Co-working Network, a series of co-working locations based at public libraries in Arizona. His team managed the startup activity of Arizona State University (Student, Faculty, Alumni) and worked closely with the ASU trechnology transfer group to support university spinouts. His team also worked with external startups, venture firms, economic development and local government to build the high tech cluster in Arizona.

recommendations: Mustafa Mousa
Co-founder and Acting CEO of Sadeem Wireless Sensing Systems
October 13, 2017, Gordon was senior to Mustafa but didn’t manage directly

Gordon simple words: everything an entrepreneur needs. I have started my entrepreneurial life one year before u met Gordon, but since the day I met him, the prospect about this “lifestyle” was never the same. Gordon is visionary mentor and a game changer to any business in his reach (specially at early stage - which portraits my experience with him). An experience that he acquired during his years and years in this field that is benefiting startups with all the tools they need to go forward. As a founder of a startup, (called Sadeem) that is mainly supervised by Gordon, we have evolved and went from the different levels a startup can take with the help of the Entrepreneurship Center in KAUST managed by  the vision of Gordon and we wouldn’t have reached the same level if it wasn’t for their continuous and unconditional support.

I have been in the Entreprenurship Center for the past three years and the least to say bout this journey with Gordon is that it has been rewarding in every way. Gordon have initiated different programs that enabled the team to explore, create, innovate, execute and simply Be who they wanted to be. His creativity have been felt and seen by everyone who dealt with him. Gordon's passion in Entreprenurship and Innovation has opened up the centers capacity beyond what it was meant to be. It has been an ultimate pleasure to work and to execute with him and he is certainly a valuable asset in every organization he joins.

Gordon is an entrepreneurial leader - a quick thinker but also with a strong strategic mind, able to prompt others into action. He has an important attribute common to most good leaders - he combines an engaging personality with a decisive manner, the ability to get things done and ensure others feel enthused.Gordon has been hugely successful at making universities behave in a business-like manner - and that is a major achievement.I would recommend Gordon without hesitation.

June 11, 2017, Dr. Sarah Mohammad worked with Gordon but at different companies

Gordon is the person you think about when the topic of entrepreneurship in Saudi Arabia comes up. He has spent the last 8 years contributing significantly to building the ecosystem for both entrepreneurship and intrapreneurship in the Kingdom and his legacy continues through the hundreds of professionals he has trained, the hundreds of startups he supported to and mentored, and the Fortune 100 companies he has contributed to through his coaching in innovation and technology. He is an expert in economic growth in the region, and I am proud to have worked with Gordon in my years in Saudi. His dedication, passion, and true belief in enterprise capacity building in Saudi is evident; it is an honor and a privilege to be his colleague and I look forward to many years to come.

Saja Muzaini
founder at Qirtas
April 22, 2017, Saja was a client of Gordon’s

I have been extremely fortunate to have Prof. Gordon as my first mentor since the early founding stages of Qirtas. It was evident since I first met him in KAUST, that his knowledge enriches any mind he reaches to.Prof. McConnell invests a big portion of his time, personal efforts and wide connections in every startup as if it’s his own. Working hand in hand, he makes sure the founders are well-rounded with their market sector, as he keeps introducing them to more ideas along the way; widening their vision while sharpening their direction. He is promptly available for a quick consultation or a thorough discussion at any time, tirelessly guiding and motivating with his rich experience, heartfelt advice, and an amusing sense of humour that makes him a one of a kind mentor. Prof. Gordon continues to highlight lessons that sums years of experience helping us nurture Qirtas’s growth and utlise our ideas and skills in their best fits. His mentorship protects us from misleading directions that we might not notice and insures our startup reaches its fullest potential. We can only think of him as the Godfather of Qirtas.

Imad Abukhalaf
Head of KAUST Industry Collaboration Program (KICP)
November 23, 2016, Imad worked with Gordon in different groups

I have known Gordon for the past 3 years when he was appointed to lead the Entrepreneurship Center (EC) at King Abdullah University of Science and Technology (KAUST). To say that Gordon has done an outstanding job would be an understatement. Under his leadership, the Entrepreneurship Center has been transformed to a world-class center winning several awards of excellence. Not only that, but a number of start-ups that got mentored by Gordon and his team were finalists in a number of competition events around the world. Gordon has truly done an exceptional job at the EC and at KAUST. He managed to create a healthy and focused entrepreneurship environment that led to the great successes the center is now known for. In addition to the many activities of the center that cater to entrepreneurs, EC organizes and hosts several key events that have become marked annual events for entrepreneurs in the region.Gordon is not only a highly dedicated mentor, but an extraordinary leader as well. He continuously develops his team and thrives to see them succeed. He is a team player and always willing to listen, collaborate and support. He welcomes new ideas and tries to turn them into actions. He is eager to help and does his best to see entrepreneurs learn, improve and advance. One of his most recent accomplishments was developing and teaching two for credit graduate courses at KAUST. It has been truly a great honor to have Gordon as colleague at KAUST and I am looking forward to continuing our strong professional relationship with him for years to come.
Imad Abukhalaf
Head of KAUST Industry Collaboration Program (KICP)

November 7, 2016, Gordon worked with Georg in the same group

Gordon is arguably the most effective change agent I have encountered in my career.  He has extremely rare and valuable combination of red-hot passion, deep subject knowledge and personal experience working with near-perfect execution of detailed plans.  The way he transformed a large part of the culture, atmosphere, mission and effectiveness of the institution during his latest role became kind of legendary.  He is the man you can trust, the man who says it straight, the man who demands 100% and gets it because he inspires it, and the man who is willingly given the loyalty and respect of those privileged to work with him because he deserves it.

summary: As Head of the Entrepreneurship Center in KAUST since May 2014, Gordon has grown the activities of the center including the development of a wide variety of Teaching & Learning programs, startup accelerators, the STEAM Innovation Challenge and corporate innovation programs such as REVelate. He was appointed a Professor of Practice in Entrepreneurship at in May 2016. Prior to Saudi Arabia, he was the Associate Vice President of Arizona State University’s Entrepreneurship & Innovation Group (EIG) and Principal Investigator of Center of Excellence in Technology Transfer (funded by the US Department of Defense) and an Assistant Professor of Practice.  During his time in ASU, his group was ranked in the top 10 in the US for university incubators according to the UBI Global Index. While in ASU he developed several new innovation initiatives including the Furnace Technology Transfer Accelerator, which won the U.S. award for Most Promising Technology Based Economic Development in 2013. Previously Gordon was Deputy CEO of the DCU Ryan Academy for Entrepreneurship in Ireland where he developed new programs such as the Business Innovation Program in 2011 and was the founder of the Propeller startup accelerator in 2010. Before the Ryan Academy, he spent several years as chief of staff to the President of Dublin City University and was architect of two of the university’s strategic plans. He was a co-founder of two funded start-up companies & worked in a number of industry roles including in Westinghouse and Accenture. He has developed and taught entrepreneurship and management curriculum in a number of colleges and universities and is a mentor to a number of startup companies in the US and Ireland.  McConnell was awarded the title of 'Arizona Tech Titan' in 2014 by the Arizona Business Journal and an Award for Excellence from KAUST in 2015. He has spoken at a number of leading conferences in the US, Canada, Russia, and Saudi Arabia including AUTM,  AURP and the GCEC.
name: Gordon McConnell
title: Professor of Practice in Entrepreneurship at King Abdullah University of Science and Technology
